item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: The footnote says using a note page gives +25 style, but elsewhere on this page, as well as on the Note Page entry, it's listed as +20. Can someone check this and change whichever one's wrong?

item.title: re:Easiest way to get 200 Style Points
item.content:encoded: Form what I remember way back dog pee was worth the indicated +75 which would mean that part of the page hasn't been updated since way back.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
You cannot:

  • Bingo other players
  • Spy on other Villages
  • Attack other Villages
  • Perform Village actions (Patrol, Collect, Paperwork, etc)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Newbie question: What happens when you get Bingo'd? What disadvantages does it give you, aside from the implicit "can't Bingo until bingo effect fades" I'm picking up from wiki pages?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: The Ninpo Mask only give the owner a chance of not ending up bingo'd when he/her is defeated (when you win)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
About the note page not working.
Could that be the the ninpo mask kicking in ?

item.title: Note paging
item.content:encoded:
I tried to bingo someone, but it wouldn't let me use a note page. Admittedly it was my first try ever, but can someone tell me where the note-ing option is?
*Nevermind, it's alright now

item.title: Easiest way to get 200 Style Points
item.content:encoded:
The guide says to use EDUT for +75 (+2 per level higher) in style points.
It doesn't explain how this happens and I wondered, since EDUT gives +40 style points and combining EDUT and Note Page gives +60 style points.

The fastest way of course is by bingo-ing someone who is at least 38 levels higher than you with a Note Page and THOM, that's very hard, but gives at least 201 style points.

The easiest way is in my opinion simply to get EDUT and bingo 5 people whom you can finish in one hit with EDUT. This saves you the trouble of getting note pages, which is a lot of work for someone without any ally that drops them.

As a comment to the anonymous poster's statement, I never noticed anything like bonus HP for my enemies while getting Feud-Starter.

item.title: Note paging
item.content:encoded: Basically you no longer know if someone has note protection until after you try it and if they do you don't get to attack them the first round you were to busy writing their name down, gives a big boost to using note protection, and it has nothing to do with if they are using Ascension or not.

item.title: RE: Note Page not working.
item.content:encoded: Does that mean they might not be using Ascension?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: It's a new feature. The game will let you use a NP even if the opponent is using note protection. But since he is using note protection, your notepage will not work.

item.title: Note Page not working.
item.content:encoded: I tried to bingo a villager leader with a Note Page. They had Grandmaster P and I had Pinky level 2. The Note Page didn't work, but no message saying they were immune to the Note. Why did the Note Page fail? Anyone know?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: after 10 bingos, your opponents start recieving a large hp bonus. i'm not sure what the calculation is, but it was something like 20~30 extra hp. my village had 2 days of peacetime, which may or may not be related.
